byline.contributor: Josh Kron contributed reporting from Kampala, Uganda.

abstract: Pope Francis visits Kenyan slum on outskirts of capital of Nairobi and delivers some of his most pointed remarks yet during first visit to African continent; Francis criticizes public policies that African countries are being urged to adopt, which he likens to new form of colonialism, and blames 'elites' for cycle of poverty and creation of slums like one he visited.
lead_paragraph: He said that “countries are frequently pressured to adopt policies typical of the culture of waste, like those aimed at lowering the birthrate.”

headline.main: Pope Francis, in Nairobi Slum, Denounces ‘New Forms of Colonialism’
headline.print_headline: In Nairobi, the Pope Denounces ‘New Forms of Colonialism’

snippet: He said that “countries are frequently pressured to adopt policies typical of the culture of waste, like those aimed at lowering the birthrate.”
